newsitem.title: TURKEY: Arafat to visit Turkey for talks on Middle East.
newsitem.headline: Arafat to visit Turkey for talks on Middle East.

text.p: Palestinian President Yasser Arafat will pay a one-day visit to Ankara on Thursday, Turkey's foreign ministry said on Monday.

Turkey's role in Middle East peace will discussed, said Palestinian representative Fouad Ben Mahmoud Yaseen. "The peace process, how it should go and Turkey's role in it will of course be on the table," he told Reuters.

A group of 16 Turkish soldiers left Turkey last week to join their commander in the West Bank town of Hebron where they will be part of an international team monitoring the Israeli handover of most of the town to the Palestinians.
Yaseen said Turkey's participation in the 180-strong Norwegian-led force was welcomed. "Turkey is the only Moslem country taking part in this force. So we are appreciative of that," he said.
Israel handed over 80 percent of Hebron to Palestinian self-rule last month under a redeployment deal.
